results.title: Life and health: the heart attack
results.creator_credit: Norman Siegel and CRM Educational Films
results.brief_description: The film opens with an extremely effective presentation of what it is like to have a heart attack. The structure and function of the heart are then discussed. Three most common forms of heart attack and their causes are examined in detail through an imaginative use of cinematic techniques. The relationship of cholesterol to heart attack is given major emphasis.

results.title: Helicopter Canada
results.creator_credit: Eugene Boyko, Peter Jones, Tom Daly, National Film Board of Canada, Derek May and Donald Brittain
results.brief_description: A helicopter was used throughout this exploration of the ten provinces. The result of this off-the-ground portraiture is a view that is big, beautiful, and continuously engrossing. Nothing here is quite the same as seen before, even Niagara Falls. Canadians will be thrilled by this Panavision view of familiar territory. The ‘Beatles’ appear briefly in a limousine. Made for international distribution for the Canadian centennial. Written by Donald Brittain and Derek May. Narrated by Stanley Jackson. Edited by Rex Tasker.

results.title: Flags = Zastave
results.creator_credit: Zoran Jovanovic, Nancy Karkowsky and Neoplanta Film
results.brief_description: Zoran Jovanovic, in simple line drawings, explores man’s complex relationship to one of his most important symbols - the flag. Only women, Jovanovic implies, see the flag not as symbol but as fabric. Animation by Predrag Pantovic and Slavomir Calic.

results.title: Colombia and Venezuela
results.creator_credit: William L. Claiborne and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description: Among the most advanced on the continent, these Caribbean countries still suffer from the ills that continue to plague all of Latin America. One crop economics, a population explosion and unequal land distribution are certainly negative influences but real changes are being made as the economy continues to expand and diversify.

results.title: Living tomorrow. No. 134
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Farmers cannot often make hay while the sun shines, and the hayfields themselves can often become junior jungles - new machinery has the answer to this problem; anthracite coal is converted into “active carbon” whose particles have a vast porous surface - they literally “hang on” to any impurities in water, leaving it as pure as a mountain stream; deflecting an oil-tanker from its course at very low speeds presents a problem. A rotating cylinder, fitted into a tanker’s rudder, transforms it from a lumbering vessel into one that is as manoeuvrable as a minnow.

results.title: Building synergy
results.creator_credit: Ron V. Brown and R and R Productions
results.brief_description: Outlines the co-operative action in Victoria between schools and the community for use of facilities such as halls, libraries and theatres. Schools designed with community use in mind are working very successfully, with co-ordination of facilities between school and community. Suitable for teachers and tertiary level.

results.title: Bridges
results.creator_credit: David Hughes and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A simply stated stimulus film on bridges. Shows children making bridges, asking questions and talking about bridges. Shots of historic bridges and bridges of Melbourne are interspersed throughout. Suitable for primary years prep-6.

results.title: Living tomorrow. No. 132
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: A hospital bed has a “mattress” of sand, and supply of air under pressure to fluidline it, moulding it to the shape of the bocy; let the bath water go and you’ll see the principle of a new machine to separate coal from rock; sometimes a badly broken leg bone will never “knit”, even if the broken sections are held together with a plate; a Birmingham surgeon has designed a frame for a broken leg which seems to heal very severe fractures by affecting the electrical charges in the bone.

results.title: The Beast of Monsieur Racine
results.creator_credit: Gene Deitch, Morton Schindel, Kratky Film and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Presents an animated adaptation of the story of the same title by Tomi Ungerer in which Monsieur Racine discovers a strange creature in his backyard. Tells how he becomes good friends with the creature but still cannot identify it and relates how he visits the Academy of Science in Paris for help. Animators include Irena Jandova, Milan Klikar, Vera Kudinova, Bohumil Sejda. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.
